User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the WATTch application.

googleId.description: Google ID of the user, obtained during Google Sign-In.

Load.title: Load
Load.description: Represents an electricity load being monitored.

userId.description: Reference to the User who owns this load. (Relationship: User 1:N Load)

loadType.description: Type of load (light, medium, heavy, universal).

name.description: Custom name given to the load.

active.description: Indicates if the load is currently active.

ElectricityData.title: ElectricityData
ElectricityData.description: Represents electricity data readings for a specific load.

id.description: Unique identifier for the electricity data entry.

loadId.description: Reference to the Load this data belongs to. (Relationship: Load 1:N ElectricityData)

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the data was recorded.

firestore.reasoning: This Firestore data structure is designed to support the WATTch application, focusing on electricity monitoring with real-time data display. The structure leverages path-based ownership for user data and nested resources to ensure secure and scalable data management. Google Sign-In integration is accommodated through the `googleId` field within the `User` entity. Authorization independence is achieved by using path-based ownership (`/users/{userId}`) which obviates the need for complex `get()` calls in security rules. The design supports the required QAPs through structural segregation; each collection is homogeneous, simplifying security rules, and list operations are secured via path-based ownership.
